data.name: indexOf polyfill
data.description:
# indexOf polyfill

Your task is to write `String.prototype.indexOf` polyfill

It must be a regular function, which does not use built-in methods

```javascript
indexOf("hello world", "world"); // 6
indexOf("tiger", "tigers");      // -1
```

### You're not allowed to use:
- Additional libraries
- indexOf, search, match, matchAll, exec

### Edge cases:
- `string` argument always will be of type string
- `searchValue` can be a string, number, array, boolean or some method
  - It should be converted to string
- `startIndex` always number
- keep `startIndex` in `>= 0 && <= string.length`
- Be careful with types to primitive, for example
  - `true + ""` equals `'true'`
  - `-Infinity + ""` equals `'-Infinity'`
  - `Date + ""` will be converted into `'function Date() { [native code] }'`
